input_text:
Job Title: Associate Digital Content Producer, Owned Content & Channels

Location: Seattle, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Description

Amazon’s Owned Content and Channels team is looking for a Digital Content Producer who will execute on our content strategy to showcase how Amazon is supporting its employees, customers, and communities around the world. This role supports AboutAmazon.com, which aims to be the first and most trusted source of information and news about Amazon for external audiences.

The team member will own end-to-end content management, optimization, and publication for online articles that support business communications teams across the Global Communications and Community Impact organization. They will support all aspects of website and partner management including, but not limited to: publishing and bar-raising articles; supporting search engine optimization (SEO) efforts for new and existing content; improving reader engagement; and providing training and writing documentation. We’re looking for someone who is a detail-oriented, data-driven, and reader-focused digital content professional. In a breaking-news environment, you’ll be expected to manage complex, fast-moving, and unexpected communications challenges while looking around corners for risk.

If you’re a digital content professional who is passionate about building and optimizing storytelling, effective in developing stakeholder support, technically proficient in SEO and content management system (CMS) tools, and familiar with web trends and analytics, we have an amazing opportunity for you.

Key job responsibilities

 Manage content projects through their lifecycle, which includes managing stakeholders and managing several projects at once CMS content development Contribute to editorial calendar planning and entry-point programming Coordinate recurring meetings with business communications teams to share insights and educational materials Develop insights and reporting using analytics tools, including A/B test experimentation Train other producers and editors and share learnings and best practices in a global team setting Conduct peer reviews to ensure articles are abiding by our style guides

A day in the life

The producer works closely with editorial and design counterparts, as well as internal, social, and business communications teams to publish high-quality breaking news and informational articles. They will review and share data points to make editorial and programming decisions to best reach our audience.

About The Team

The Owned Content & Channels team, which sits within the Global Communications and Community Impact organization, develops content for the general population, to educate and share news and stories about how Amazon supports our customers, employees, and communities.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Seattle, WA, USA

Basic Qualifications

 2+ years of recent professional communications, newsroom, or public relations experience Bachelor's degree in journalism, communications, public relations, or a related field

Preferred Qualifications

 Excellent oral and written communicator, comfortable with senior management visibility Strong sense of editorial tone and voice Experience working cross-functionally and influencing without authority Knowledgeable about SEO and digital media trends, and how to apply these insights to their work Exceptional team player with a positive attitude who is willing to roll up their sleeves to get the job done

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $48,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $116,300/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2616071

Experience Level (if available): None
